name: apostolic
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
relating to the Apostles (= the group of early Christians who travelled to different places telling people about Jesus Christ): The once united apostolic church splintered over issues of power, governance, and doctrine. These people had a deeply apostolic and missionary spirit.
relating to the authority of the Pope (= the leader of the Roman Catholic Church), especially when this is seen as coming from St. Peter or the Apostles: an apostolic letter The apostolic nuncio is the Pope's ambassador. The cardinal was appointed an apostolic administrator. See
apostle
More examplesFewer examplesSome Christian churches believe in apostolic succession of their bishops, who trace their authority back to the Apostles.He is a wonderful preacher and a truly apostolic missionary.The group is a women’s apostolic religious community.
